work.summary: Researched the hallucination problem in large language models (LLM). Built an automatized pipeline to construct a hallucination dataset using ChatGPT and a reward model to train LLM with RL. Selected as an outstanding intern.

publications.name: Evaluating Generalization Capabilities of LLM-Based Agents in Mixed-Motive Scenarios Using Concordia.
publications.publisher: The Thirty-ninth Annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems Datasets and Benchmarks Track
publications.summary: In this paper we introduce a method for evaluating cooperation in LLM-based agents with unfamiliar co-players in novel, mixed-motive scenarios, and report the analytical techniques, methods, and results of the 2024 Concordia Contest.

publications.name: Emergent Linear Separability of Unseen Data Points in High-dimensional Last-Layer Feature Space.
publications.publisher: Workshop on High-dimensional Learning Dynamics at ICML 2024
publications.summary: We propose a simple geometric uncertainty measure based on linear separability in the last-layer feature space of deep networks, offering a theoretically grounded and non-probabilistic approach to uncertainty quantification.

publications.name: ABC3: Active Bayesian Causal Inference with Cohn Criteria in Randomized Experiments.
publications.publisher: In The 39th Annual AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence
publications.summary: We introduce ABC3, a highly efficient active learning method for randomized experiment, with several theoretical properties.

publications.name: Pre-trained Language Models Return Distinguishable Probability Distributions to Unfaithfully Hallucinated Texts.
publications.publisher: Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics: EMNLP 2024 (EMNLP 2024 Findings)
publications.summary: We show the pre-trained language models return distinguishable generation probability and uncertainty distribution to unfaithfully hallucinated texts, regardless of their size and structure.

publications.name: Evaluating Extrapolation Ability of Large Language Model in Chemical Domain.
publications.summary: LLM can extrapolate to new unseen material utilizing its chemical knowledge learned through massive pre-training.

publications.name: SentenceLDA: Discriminative and Robust Document Representation with Sentence Level Topic Model
publications.publisher:
In Proceedings of the 18th Conference of the European Chapter of the
Association for Computational Linguistics (EACL 2024)
publications.summary: We propose SentenceLDA, a sentence-level topic model. We combine modern SentenceBERT and classical LDA to extend the semantic unit from word to sentence.

publications.name: Noun-MWP: Math Word Problems Meet Noun Answers
publications.publisher: In Proceedings of the 29th International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING 2022)
publications.summary: We introduce a new type of problems for math word problem (MWP) solvers, named Noun-MWPs, whose answer is a non-numerical string containing a noun from the problem text.
